messages.content: I need to set up my new MacBook for development. Let me document the setup. I use VS Code with Vim keybindings - can you check if my settings.json is backed up?
Found your VS Code settings backup in the dotfiles repo. It has vim.enable: true and your preferred theme. Ready to restore.
Good. I also use iTerm2 with zsh and oh-my-zsh. Make sure my shell config is there too. Then I need to set up uv for Python package management - we switched from pip recently.
Found your .zshrc with oh-my-zsh config. Installing uv via curl and verified it's in PATH. Also installing pnpm for Node.js package management.
Yes, pnpm for Node.js. Now set up the local database. We run PostgreSQL in Docker Compose on port 5433 - we use that non-standard port to avoid conflicts with any local PostgreSQL installations.
Started PostgreSQL container via docker-compose. Mapped to port 5433. Verified connection works. Also ran Alembic migrations to set up the schema.
Don't forget to copy the .env.example to .env.local for the environment variables. That's where all our local dev config goes. The .env.local file is gitignored so secrets stay local.
Copied .env.example to .env.local and filled in the local PostgreSQL connection string for port 5433. Also set up the pre-commit hooks by running pre-commit install.
